ARABIC: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَا يَخَافُ ظُلْمًا وَلَا هَضْمًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But anyone who does right actions, being a mumin, need fear no wrong or any belittlement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But he who has done good things and believes, will have no fear of either being wronged or deprived.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: but whosoever does righteous works, being a believer, shall have no fear of suffering wrong or loss."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The righteously striving believers should have no fear of being treated with injustice or inequity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the one who does some good deeds, and is a Muslim – he shall have no fear of injustice, nor suffer any loss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And he who works deeds of righteousness, while he is a believer, then he will have no fear of injustice, nor of any curtailment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And whoever does good works and he is a believer, he shall have no fear of injustice nor of the withholding of his due.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: but whosoever does deeds of righteousness, being a believer, shall fear neither wrong nor injustice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he who hath done some good works, being a believer, he feareth not injustice nor begrudging (of his wage).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but he who does good works, being a believer, shall fear no harm nor any injustice."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And whosoever worketh of the righteous works, and is a believer, he will not fear Wrong or begrudging
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But whoever does righteous deeds, being faithful, will neither fear any injustice or disparagement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But he who works deeds of righteousness, and has faith, will have no fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And he who works deeds of righteousness, while he is a believer (in Islamic Monotheism) then he will have no fear of injustice, nor of any curtailment (of his reward).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: but those who have believed and done good works shall fear neither wrong nor injustice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But whoever has done righteous deeds, while being a believer—will fear neither injustice, nor grievance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:112] But whoever does righteous deeds, acts of obedience, being a believer, shall fear neither wrong, by having his evil deeds increased, nor injustice, by having his good deeds diminished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And he who hath done some good works) between him and his Lord, (being a believer) true in his faith, (he fears not injustice) he does not fear the thwarting of all his works (nor begrudging) nor the decrease of his works.
